description: From lip (“fleshy protrusion around the opening of the mouth; (slang) verbal impertinence, backtalk”) +‎ -y (suffix forming adjectives with the sense of ‘having the quality of’).

entries.meaning: (informal) Having a tendency to talk back in a cheeky or impertinent manner.

nouns.description: lippy (countable and uncountable, plural lippies) (originally Australia, now also Britain, New Zealand, colloquial)

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Lip gloss or lipstick; (countable) a stick of this product.

description: From leap (“trap or snare for fish made from twigs; (obsolete) basket”)  +‎ -y (diminutive suffix).

entries.meaning: (Scotland, historical) An old dry measure amounting to one quarter of a peck (for goods sold by weight, 1¾ pounds or about four-fifths of a kilogram); also, a container of that capacity.
